result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn E Londre

records.addlTxt:
8:33 AM Defendant Shawn E Londre in court, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst in court for Shawn E Londre.  Prosecuting attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Victim S. S is present in court and makes a statement on the record. 
State indicates victims have not received notification of the bond motion filed by Defense. The State is asking for the bond to remain the same. State makes statements on the record. 
Defense is requesting another status date. Defense makes arguments regarding the bond motion they filed. Is seeking the cash bond is modified to a signature bond. 
BTC: Defense's motion to modify bond is denied. Matter set over.
